result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshay M Merchant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
All court costs, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determnies to be reasonable and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 16CF3971 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow all rules of supervision. 
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Bail Notice mailed to surety on 02/08/17.  vp

Defendant Deshay M Merchant in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Deshay M Merchant in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  42 MONTHS with 164 days credit CONCURRENT to case #16CF3971 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 28 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

 -Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant DeShay M Merchant in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant DeShay M Merchant in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Additional statements by: 
Rhiannon V
